title: What songs have strong hidden messages or meanings in the lyrics? - Quora

response.answer_text: I don’t really know of any, but there are several that people imagined that there were hidden messages and meanings in them. For Viet Nam vets, they remember songs like The Animals I Gotta Get Outta This Place Peter, Paul, and Mary sang Puff! The Magic Dragon. Lot’s of smokers thought it was about marijuana and the boys in Viet Nam thought it was about a C-47 gunship nicknamed Puff The Magic Dragon. But the writer and the artists say it’s a kid’s tale. There were also direct lyrics for the war in Viet Nam. Steppenwolf’s The Draft resister or Monster, Suicide, America. ( We don’t now how to mind our own business,cause the whole world’s got to be just like us, Now we are fighting a war over there, no matter who’s the winner, we can’t pay the cost.) Barry McGuire Eve of Destruction Edwin Starr War! What Is It Good For? There are many others. There are many songs that when played backwards, seem to have Satanic messages in them…Stairway to Heaven is about the most famous. Queen’s Another One Bites the Dust is another. Summer of 69 is NOT about buying a first guitar in 1969. It’s about the guitar alright, but the 69 is his sexual awakening, using the position as a reference. If you want more, just look on the web for songs with hidden messages.
Miracles by Jefferson Starship Relax by Frankie goes to Hollywood Afternoon Delight by Starlight Vocal Band Just too many to list…
